result.execSummary:
The defendant Kerry Lyn Nimmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entry into any bars or taverns.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample.
Defendant is to take all medications as prescribed to her by treating physicians and in the manner in which they are prescribed.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting per week.

timeConds.notes: Huber and good time allowed. Eligile for community service under 973.03(3). No objections to serving the sentence in any other county in the State of Wisconsin but is the ultimate decision of each Sheriff.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count 1, no additional jail time or community service.
Concurrent with: Count #1

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kerry Lyn Nimmer in court with attorney Brett Tyler Kaehne.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 12:59 PM. State - resolved - plead G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, DRI #3, parties are free to argue incarceration time, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 5 years with conditions. Kaehne and Nimmer agree and provides court with plea questionnaire. Court dismisses and reads in count #3. Nimmer pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - request 1 year of conditional jail time with other conditions of: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns or similar establishments, take all medications as prescribed by a treating physician or medical provider, employment, 300 hours of community service, restitution of $600.00 to FOSO Drug Task Force. Kaehne makes final argument prior to sentencing - argues for less jail time of 8 months with 4 months jail imposed and 4 months stayed at the discretion of P&P for stated reasons - requests time to report (at least two weeks) and that the defendant be allowed to serve her sentence in Manitowoc County - 5 days credit if revoked - request huber for counseling, employment and child care. Nimmer makes statement, remorseful, defense counsel read her prepared statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 5 years, concurrent to each other,  with conditions of: 10 months in county jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - no objections to serving the sentence in any other county in the State of WI but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff - credit for 5 days only if revoked - report by 12:00 noon on 3/11/16, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, take all medications as prescribed by treating physicians and in the manner in which they are prescribed, costs of $600.00 for drug reimbursement buy money -take bond posted, attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week, costs on each count - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation, 300 hours of community service, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal.

Defendant Kerry Lyn Nimmer in court with attorney Brett Tyler Kaehne.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:24 PM. Motion was filed to disclose of CI, additional discovery because as of today he has not seen discovery yet. State - indicates they have faxed information to attorney this morning. Re-called 1:35 PM - Kaehne has had time to review discovery provided by state in court and informs court he is waiting for packet from crime lab and not sure if will be filed before trial date but would like to keep trial date. Motions in Limine will be addressed morning of trial. Kaehne no negotions have been held with him at this point, original offer will not be accepted that was given to defendant by original counsel and also wants to make the court aware that defendant is currently dealing with some health issues. Bond continued.
From Attorney Kaehne indicating no resolution has been reached and request a JT date.
to Compel Disclosure of Confidential Informant
Attorney for the defendant and the Manitowoc County prosecutor are working to get this matter consolidated with the Manitowoc case.
To Judge regarding Discovery from DA. Copy of letter from DA.

Defendant Kerry Lyn Nimmer in court with attorney Brent Harold DeBord.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:07 a.m. State - belives there is goint to be a waiver and has filed information which mirrors complaint. Court has preliminary hearing waiver form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Court takes short recess to allow time for attorney to discuss proceeding with arraignment with client. Re-called 11:15 a.m. - Same appearances. DeBord would like to proceed now with ARGN, has information and waives further reading, enters NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on both cases and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
verbally quashed by Judge per phone call

Called 3:59 pm. No appearance by defendant or any attorney on her behalf. JBC appears on behalf of the State. Court reviews minutes from last hearing. Notice of the hearing was sent to attorney Burns and defendant for today's hearing. Attorney Roley was appointed by SPD on 2/5/15. Attorney Roley had filed substitution however not in proper form and court does not accept it. State asks for warrant. Court forfeits bond posted and issues warrant for  body/$500. Adj 4:02 pm.
of judge - denied as not in proper form
and certificate of appearance - Deputy TR

Called at 9:22 AM. Kerry Nimmer appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Burns has complaint, waives reading, does have a conflict but and asks for AIA as can't proceed today, asking if defendant can appear telephonically at the next hearing for stated reasons. Court would prefer to set the matter for a PH and possibly get a waiver for that and then she can appear telephonically. Burns responds. Recess to talk to client. Court continues bond, sets for PH on 2/11/15 at 4:00 PM.
No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Called at 10:27 AM. Kerry Nimmer appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Nimmer has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Nimmer understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford to hire her own and believes she is eligible for SPD, daughter has attempted to contact SPD already. Court instructs defendant to contact SPD today for representation. Court sets this matter for AIA on 1/21/15 at 9:30 AM. State - bond - $2500 cash bond with no possession of any prescriptions not prescribed to her or administrered by her thru her employment. Nimmer - bond - asks for lower cash bond for stated reasons. State objects. Court - bond - $1000.00 cash - can review again once counsel is appointed - conditions include: no possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
